    Reading

    Gustavo Pinto

    Software Engineering Research

    • DBLP

    A few suggestions for (prospective) grad students, in no particular order:

    Must read

    1. Advice for researchers and students, by Michael Ernst
    2. The care and maintenance of your adviser
    3. The Ph.D. Grind, by Philip Guo
    4. What My PhD Was Like, by Jean Yang
    5. 12 resolutions for grad students, by Matt Might
    6. The Nine Circles of Scientific Hell

    Paper reading

    1. How to critically read papers

    Paper writing

    1. How to Write an Abstract, by Philip Koopman
    2. Writing Academic Papers, by Sarah Nadi
    3. Writing Good Software Engineering Research Papers, by Mary Shaw
    4. How to write a great research paper, by Simon Peyton Jones
    5. Why I gave your paper a Strong Reject, by Matt Welsh
    6. Statistical Mistakes and How to Avoid Them, by Adrian Sampson
    7. How to Extend a Conference Paper to a Journal Paper, by Jeff Offutt
    8. Advice for writing LaTeX documents, by Diomidis Spinellis
    9. Things I Keep Repeating About Writing, by Claire Le Goues

    Reviewing papers

    1. Reviewing a technical paper, by Michael Ernst
    2. Hints for Reviewing Empirical Work in Software Engineering, by Walter F. Tichy

    Talks

    1. How to give a great research talk, by Simon Peyton Jones
    2. Summarizing your presentation with miniature slides, by Andreas Zeller

    Rejections

    1. Dealing with Rejection, by Niklas Elmqvist

    Where to find money

    1. PAC SIGPLAN
    2. CAPS SIGSOFT
    3. Tips for attending OOPSLA with low budget

    Fun

    1. PHD Comics
